intro: Urostigma callophyllum, commonly known as the silky sandmat, is a perennial flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the family Amaranthaceae and is characterized by its soft, hairy foliage and small, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows in sandy or gravelly soils and is adapted to arid environments. Its leaves are lance-shaped and often covered in fine, silky hairs, which help reduce water loss. Urostigma callophyllum is often found in disturbed areas and can thrive in full sun.
